info.title: FME Flow REST API V4
info.description:
FME Flow REST API V4 is currently in Technology Preview.

Note: This REST API is still under active development, so please expect changes to the current behavior. We do not recommend using the FME Flow REST API V4 in production environments.

You accept all risks of using Technology Preview materials whether or not the risks are foreseeable or reasonable.

Response Codes

Success response codes are displayed for each call in the detailed documentation below.

Below is a listing of possible error response codes:

  • 400 Bad Request
  • 401 Unauthorized
  • 403 Forbidden
  • 404 Not Found
  • 405 Method Not Allowed
  • 409 Conflict
  • 422 Unprocessable Entity
  • 500 Internal Server Error
  • 503 Service Unavailable

get.summary: Retrieve the registered services and service configurations of a workspace
get.description: Retrieves a list of FME Flow services and service configurations of a workspace.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository containing the proper workspace

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The name of the workspace to get services from

put.summary: Replace the registered services and service configurations of a workspace
put.description: Replaces the set of FME Flow services and service configurations registered to a workspace.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository containing the proper workspace

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The name of the workspace to replace services for

requestBody.description: FME Flow services and service configurations to register the workspace. Any unspecified services will be deregistered.

put.summary: Register or deregister a service to a workspace
put.description: Registers or deregisters a service to a workspace

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: The name of the repository containing the proper workspace.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The name of the workspace to update service registration for.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: The name of the service to register or deregister.

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of results to return, which is useful for iterative results paging. The limit can be any number between 0 to 1000 inclusive.

parameters.description: Specifies the offset to start the result, which is useful for iterative results paging. An offset of 0 will return results starting from the first entry. The offset can be any number greater than or equal to 0.

get.summary: Retrieves the configuration settings for FME Flow cleanup
get.description: Retrieves the configuration settings for FME Flow cleanup. A warning level event will trigger all cleanup tasks to execute as they are configured. A critical level event will trigger all cleanup tasks to execute and disregard max age constraints. This means resources are purged regardless of how old they are.

put.summary: Updates the configuration settings for FME Flow cleanup
put.description: Updates the configuration settings for FME Flow cleanup. A warning level event will trigger all cleanup tasks to execute as they are configured. A critical level event will trigger all cleanup tasks to execute and disregard max age constraints. This means resources are purged regardless of how old they are.

get.description: Retrieves the records for all jobs of the given status.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Jobs matching any of the specified statuses will be returned.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description:
If specified, only jobs run by the specified user will be returned. When a job runs in the context of these FME Flow mechanisms, `userID` means the following:
* Automation: The user that last enabled the automation to run the job.
* FME Flow Web Services: The user that ran the job.
* Schedule: The user that last updated the schedule.
* Stream: The user who owns the stream.
* Workspace App (no authentication required): The user that owns the security token that is used to run the job from the app.
* Workspace App (authentication required): The user that owns the security token that is used to run the job from the app.
* Automation App: The user that last enabled the automation to run the job.
* Webhook URL: The user that owns the security token for the webhook URL.
* Run Workspace with FMEFlowJobSubmitter transformer: The user account that authenticates the FME Flow connection in the transformer.

parameters.name: engineName
parameters.description: If specified, only jobs run by the specified engine will be returned. Queued jobs cannot be filtered by engine.

parameters.name: repository
parameters.description: If specified, only jobs from the specified repository will be returned.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: If specified along with repository, only jobs from the specified repository and workspace will be returned.

parameters.name: sourceType
parameters.description: If specified, only jobs run by this source type will be returned.

parameters.name: queue
parameters.description: If specified, only jobs routed through the specified queue will be returned.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order of the result. Append `_asc` to the property name to sort in ascending order or `_desc` to sort in descending order. For example, `workspace_asc` to sort by workspace in ascending order. If the suffix is unspecified, the property will be sorted in ascending order. If no sorting parameter is specified, the result will be sorted by `timeFinished` in descending order by default.  Sorting is only supported on `workspace`, `timeFinished`, `timeStarted`, and `status`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of results to return, which is useful for iterative results paging. The limit can be any number between 0 to 1000 inclusive.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Specifies the offset to start the result, which is useful for iterative results paging. An offset of 0 will return results starting from the first entry. The offset can be any number greater than or equal to 0.

post.summary: Submit a job to be run
post.description: Submits a job to be run.  If sync is true, a response is not returned until the job completes, or the timeout has been reached. If sync is false, the ID of the running job is returned immediately, regardless of job status. Each published parameter contains a `value` attribute that may contain either a list of items or a straightforward text value depending on the type of published parameter.  If published parameters are omitted, default values are provided by the workspace.  If any directives are omitted, the server assigns default values.

parameters.name: sync
parameters.description: If true, the request will not return until the job is complete or the timeout has been reached.

202.description: The synchronous job transformation was submitted successfully but the timeout was reached. The job ID is rendered in the response body.

post.summary: Cancel a running or queued job
post.description: Cancels the job and marks it as aborted in the completed jobs section, but does not remove it from the database. To completely remove a job, issue a second request to `DELETE /<job id>`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the job to cancel.

userName.description:
The username of the FME Flow user that ran the job. When a job runs in the context of these FME Flow mechanisms, `userName` means the following:
* Automation: The user that last enabled the automation to run the job.
* FME Flow Web Services: The user that ran the job.
* Schedule: The user that last updated the schedule.
* Stream: The user who owns the stream.
* Workspace App (no authentication required): The user that owns the security token that is used to run the job from the app.
* Workspace App (authentication required): The user that owns the security token that is used to run the job from the app.
* Automation App: The user that last enabled the automation to run the job.
* Webhook URL: The user that owns the security token for the webhook URL.
* Run Workspace with FMEFlowJobSubmitter transformer: The user account that authenticates the FME Flow connection in the transformer.
